column4: I have sound working but if I load any games I have no sound. Any ideas?
disable esd via System> Preferences> Sound> Enable sound server startup   prior to starting your game, and reenable it when you exit your game
many games use oss [emulation] , which hog the sound device
I didn't have to do that with my last install, there was a library or something missing, i just forget what it was. I am talking little simple games
thus you can't expect to hear system sounds when you're playing an oss game unless you use the aoss script, part of the alsa-oss package

I had this problem a month ago on another machine, someone in here told me to install something, I think lib??? and then it worked. the way it is not is like it was on the other maching before doing that, sound settings are not even on in the games. there is something missing
what lib?
perhaps it's easier if you say which game
dpkg -l libsdl1.2debian-alsa|grep ^ii
ok, it did nothing?
sudo apt-get install libsdl1.2debian-alsa
it's fine if by installing that package other libsdl1.2debian* ones are removed
they are i am trying now
worked, thank you very much. that must have been it
excellent
is there a reason not to use  libsdl1.2debian-esd??? since i have things set to esd?
well, if you have esd running, sure you can install libsdl1.2debian-esd, but I think you'll find that performance suffers
